result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary M. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Cooperate with the Divsion of Children and Family Services.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Mary M. Clark, appeared with Attorney Margaret Susan O'Connor.  Clerk: PT
Court takes judicial notice of 15JC89/15JC90/15JC91 and sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.   Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Mary M. Clark, appeared with Attorney Margaret Susan O'Connor.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.   PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Mary M. Clark, appeared with Attorney Margaret Susan O'Connor.  Clerk: PT
Attorney O'Connor requests an adjournment for further negotiation with the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 09:20 am.
Final pre-trial on May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am and confirmed with Atty O'Connor's Office.
